Class VectorizedHitDetector

java.lang.Object
com.arbergashi.charts.engine.spatial.VectorizedHitDetector
public final class VectorizedHitDetector extends Object
SIMD-aware hit detector for spatial buffers.

Platform-independent and headless-certified. No AWT/Swing dependencies.

Since:
2.0.0
Version:
2.0.0
Author:
Arber Gashi

      public static VectorizedHitDetector getShared()
      Returns a shared hit detector instance for reuse across layers.
      Returns:
      shared detector
      Since:

    • findHitIndex

      public int findHitIndex(SpatialBuffer buffer, int count, double x, double y, double radius)
      Legacy-friendly alias for hit detection.
      Parameters:
      buffer - spatial buffer
      count - number of points
      x - target x
      y - target y
      radius - hit radius
      Returns:
      nearest point index or -1

    • getNearestIndex

      public int getNearestIndex(SpatialBuffer buffer, int count, double x, double y, double radius, boolean useOutputCoords)
      Returns the nearest point index within the given radius, or -1 if none match.
      Parameters:
      buffer - spatial buffer
      count - number of points
      x - target x
      y - target y
      radius - hit radius
      useOutputCoords - true to read from outputCoords instead of inputCoords
      Returns:
      nearest point index or -1

    • getNearestIndexPreferPeaks

      public int getNearestIndexPreferPeaks(SpatialBuffer buffer, int count, double x, double y, double radius, boolean useOutputCoords, SpatialPeakMetadata peaks)
      Returns the nearest point index within the given radius, preferring peak anchors when available.

      If a peak anchor is within the radius, the search is re-centered on that peak to find the closest actual buffer point.

      Parameters:
      buffer - spatial buffer
      count - number of points
      x - target x
      y - target y
      radius - hit radius
      useOutputCoords - true to read from outputCoords instead of inputCoords
      peaks - peak metadata (may be null)
      Returns:
      nearest point index or -1
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • getNearestIndexPreferPeaks

      public int getNearestIndexPreferPeaks(SpatialBuffer buffer, int count, double x, double y, double radius, boolean useOutputCoords, SpatialPeakProvider peakProvider)
      Returns the nearest point index within the given radius, preferring peak anchors from a provider.
      Parameters:
      buffer - spatial buffer
      count - number of points
      x - target x
      y - target y
      radius - hit radius
      useOutputCoords - true to read from outputCoords instead of inputCoords
      peakProvider - peak provider (may be null)
      Returns:
      nearest point index or -1
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • getNearestIndexInBox

      public int getNearestIndexInBox(SpatialBuffer buffer, int count, double x, double y, double z, double halfX, double halfY, double halfZ, boolean useOutputCoords)
      Returns the nearest point index inside a 3D box centered at (x,y,z).
      Parameters:
      buffer - spatial buffer
      count - number of points
      x - target x
      y - target y
      z - target z
      halfX - half width of box
      halfY - half height of box
      halfZ - half depth of box
      useOutputCoords - true to read from outputCoords instead of inputCoords
      Returns:
      nearest point index or -1
